tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE CommunicationLogs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  responder_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  message TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE crisis_events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    event_date DATE NOT NULL,
    event_location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    event_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE communication_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_id INT NOT NULL,
    responder_id INT NOT NULL,
    log_timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    log_message TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE emergency_responders (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  responder_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  contact_number VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE crisis_situations (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  crisis_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  start_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  end_time TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE communication_logs (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  responder_id INT NOT NULL,
  situation_id INT NOT NULL,
  communication_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  message TEXT NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE responder_locations (
  responder_id INT NOT NULL,
  location VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  last_updated TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
)

CREATE TABLE communication_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  crisis_id INT,
  responder_id INT,
  log_message TEXT NOT NULL,
  log_datetime DATETIME,
  FOREIGN KEY (crisis_id) REFERENCES crisis_situations(crisis_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (responder_id) REFERENCES emergency_responders(responder_id)
);

CREATE TABLE message_recipients (
  message_id INT,
  responder_id INT,
  PRIMARY KEY (message_id, responder_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (message_id) REFERENCES communication_logs(log_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (responder_id) REFERENCES emergency_responders(responder_id)
);

CREATE TABLE alert_notifications (
  notification_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  crisis_id INT,
  notification_message TEXT NOT NULL,
  notification_datetime DATETIME,
  FOREIGN KEY (crisis_id) REFERENCES crisis_situations(crisis_id)
);
